result.execSummary:
The defendant Derek W Hebel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery by Prisoners, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: 2:35 P.M., Defendant Derek W Hebel in court, in custody by video from Columbia Correctional Institution.  Christine Marie Genda appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant requesting DNA Sample and Surcharge be vacated, Atty Genda objects, Court denies motion, 2:40 P.M.
Hearing at 03-31-2016 02:30 pm
ADA Genda requests the Court deny defendant's motion to vacate.
To Vacate DNA surcharge filed by defendant
from defendant regarding DNA surcharge
filed by Court Reporter Marjorie Kurtz, Feb. 12, 2015 plea/sentencing
and Notice of Right to Seek Post Conviction Relief filed by defendant/counsel
filed by Atty Genda

Defendant Derek W Hebel in court, in custody with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Chris Genda appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Waiver of Right to Prelim filed, Court accepts Waiver, probable cause found, bound over, Information filed, waives reading, Rights/Elements, Defendant pleads no contest to Ct. 1, Judgment to be entered, Repeater Enhancer dismissed, Court sentences defendant to: 1 year 6 months prison, 1 year initial confinement, 6 months extended supervision, consecutive, $518.00 costs and defendant to provide DNA Sample, Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program or Substance Abuse Program,
with Petition for Writ of Habeas Corpus to CCI for 02-12-15 at 9:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on February 12, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Atty Riek requests Dec. 22, 2014 hearing be reset. Out of office - fax
and Notice of DNA and Witness List filed by Atty Genda
with Petition for Writ of Habeas Corpus to CCI for Dec. 22, 2014 at 2:45
Appointed Attorney Amanda Riek
For Preservation of Evidence filed by Atty. Riek
Petition For Leave to File Additional Motions filed by Atty. Riek

Defendant Derek W Hebel in court, in custody, pro se.  Christine M. Genda appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant wished to have attorney. Court advised defendant to contact public defender office.  Hearing scheduled for December 22, 2014 at 02:45 pm.
and filed.
with Petition for Writ of Habeas Corpus to CCI for 10/28/14 at 2:45
Pre-trial conference on October 13, 2014 at 01:20 pm.

Defendant, Derek W Hebel, appeared pro se by video conferencing from CCI. Jordan Lippert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Reading waived. $1,000 recog. with felony conds. Time limits recited. Defendant waived.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 14, 2014 at 01:20 pm.  Hearing scheduled for October 28, 2014 at 02:45 pm.
Initial appearance on September 11, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
